Question
========

In a sample of 17 individuals, the Pearson product moment correlation coefficient was calculated between systolic and diastolic blood pressure, resulting in the value 0.845. The percentage of variation that the two variables have *not* in common is (in this sample) equal to

Answerlist
----------

* 15.5%
* 20.4%
* 28.6%
* 71.4%

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 15.5%: Incorrect
* 20.4%: Incorrect
* 28.6%: Correct
* 71.4%: Incorrect
